Main Table Setup (1) Commands Main Table Commands are newly assigned to the extension part of AUTO SELECT ASSIGN Commands on DVS PROTOCOL ============================================================== READ: 06 20 11 51 80 MM MM WRITE: 0A 20 D1 11 80 MM MM VV VV KK KK MM MM = Main Button No.: 001 - 12Ch (1 - 300) VV VV = Video Source No.: 001 - 136h (1 - 310) / Refer to Table.A KK KK = Key Source No.: 001 - 136h (1 - 310) / Refer to Table.A ============================================================== (2) Examples Assign “V = PRIMARY 79 / K = PRIMARY 80” to “Button No.10”. (WRITE) (TX) 0A 20 D1 11 80 00 0A 00 4F 00 50 (RX) 84 Assign “V = FRAME MEMORY 1 / K = WHITE” to “Button No.11”. (WRITE) (TX) 0A 20 D1 11 80 00 0B 00 BB 00 B6 (RX) 84 Find the “V / K” assignment of “Button No.12”. (READ) Get “V = PRIMARY 14 / K = PRIMARY 15” as RESPONSE. (TX) 06 20 51 11 80 00 0C (RX) 0A 20 D1 11 80 00 0C 00 0E 00 0F 6. Main Table Setup (1) Commands Sub Table Commands are assigned to the MULTI XPT ASSIGN commands on DVS PROTOCOL. ============================================================== READ: 05 20 51 1F TT SS WRITE: 07 20 D1 1F TT SS MM MM TT = Sub Table No.: 00 - 0Dh (Table1-14) SS = Sub Button No.: 01 - 80h (1 - 128) MM MM = Main Button No.: 001 - 12Ch (1 - 300) ============================================================== (2) Examples Assign “Main Button No.30” to “Button No.10” of “Sub Table 2”. (WRITE) (TX) 07 20 D1 1F 01 0A 00 1E (RX) 84 Find “Main Button No.” assigned to “Button No.11” of “Sub Table.3”. (READ) Get “Main Button No.31” as RESPONSE. (TX) 05 20 51 1F 02 0B (RX) 07 20 D1 1F 02 0B 00 1F 7. Output Assign (1) Commands Output Assign Commands are assigned to the ASSIGN OUT 2 commands on DVS PROTOCOL. ============================================================== READ: 04 20 51 24 PP WRITE: 06 20 D1 24 PP QQ QQ PP = Output No.: 01 - 30h (1 - 48) QQ QQ = Source No.: 001 - 136h (1 - 310) / Refer to Table.B ============================================================== (2) Examples Assign “AUX 15” to “Output No.12”. (WRITE) (TX) 06 20 D1 24 0C 00 0F (RX) 84 Find “Source No.” assigned to “Output No.13”. (READ) Get “EDIT PVW” as RESPONSE (TX) 04 20 51 24 0D (RX) 06 20 D1 24 0D 00 46 8. Source Name Setup (1) Commands Source Name Commands are assigned to the NAME commands on DVS PROTOCOL. ============================================================== READ: 05 20 70 50 XX XX WRITE: LL 20 F0 50 XX XX NN NN,,,NN XX = Source No.: 001 - 136h (1 - 310) / Refer to Table.A LL = Byte Count: Name Length + 5 NN NN,,,NN = Source Name: ASCII, Max 16 characters ============================================================== (2) Examples Name “CAM1” to “Source = PRIMARY 13”. (WRITE) (TX) 09 20 F0 50 00 0D 43 41 4D 31 (RX) 84 Request “Source Name” named to “Source = COLOR BKGD 1”. (READ) Get "CB1" as RESPONSE. (TX) 05 20 70 50 00 B7 (RX) 08 20 F0 50 00 B7 43 42 31 9. Xpt Table Assign (1) Commands Xpt Table Commands are assigned to the XPT TABLE ASSIGN commands on DVS PROTOCOL. ============================================================== READ: 04 20 51 1D YY WRITE: 05 20 D1 1D YY ZZ YY = Bank Bus No.: 01 - 93h (1 - 147) / Refer to Table.C ZZ = Xpt Table No.: 00 = Main, 01 = Sub1, 02 = Sub2 ... 0Eh = Sub14 ============================================================== (2) Examples Assign “Main Table (00)” to “M/E-1 (01)”. (WRITE) (TX) 05 20 D1 1D 01 00 (RX) 84 Request “Xpt Table” assigned to “AUX2 (06)”. (READ) Get "Sub Table 2 (02)" as RESPONSE. (TX) 04 20 51 1D 06 (RX) 05 20 D1 1D 06 02 10.
